image.altText: Mal sits and smiles in the stands with other starts, wearing a red t-shirt.

props.synopsis: It was 25 years ago when Cathy Freeman crossed the line into history, winning gold in the 400m at the 2000 Olympics, a moment that's vivid in the memory of gun starter Mal Davies.

title.children: How starter Mal stayed calm before Cathy Freeman's winning race

image.altText: Scene of light rail death Canberra

props.synopsis: A 49-year-old Canberra man died after being struck by a light rail vehicle on Saturday evening.

title.children: Man dies after being hit by light rail vehicle in Canberra

image.altText: An artist's render of a modern theatre building at sunset, with a few hundred people standing out the front.

props.synopsis: Detailed designs show plans for the new 2,000-seat lyric theatre, inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks, which will host major musicals, ballets and operas.

title.children: 'Scale and sophistication': New Canberra lyric theatre designs revealed

image.altText: Del sticks her tongue out, pretending to be a cat and wearing her costume and sitting near the stage.

props.synopsis: By day, Canberra public servant Del Goncalves works in a typical office and wears typical office clothes, but come nightfall, she dons a bunny costume and trades her office for a wrestling ring.

title.children: Canberra car dealers and public servants by day, pro wrestlers by night

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios stands in front of a microphone, flanked by two ACT politicians.

props.synopsis: Construction on a new $9.9 million tennis facility in the Gungahlin has begun five years after the ACT government pledged funding for it ahead of the 2020 territory election.

title.children: Nick Kyrgios spruiks construction of $9.9m tennis facility in Canberra's north

image.altText: Canberra's coat of arms

props.synopsis: The trial of a teenage girl accused of sexually assaulting and stalking her former boyfriend ends with no result, after an ACT Supreme Court jury is unable to reach a verdict.

title.children: Jury unable to reach verdict in trial of a teen girl accused of assaulting, stalking ex

image.altText: A painting of Costa Georgiadis surrounded by trees, insects and animals.

props.synopsis: The National Portrait Gallery invited the public to identify a person who was missing from its collection — the winner, chosen from a shortlist of 25 remarkable Australians, was Gardening Australia host Costa Georgiadis.

title.children: Painting of Costa Georgiadis unveiled at National Portrait Gallery

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman's hands clasped on a lap

props.synopsis: The ACT government says coercive control will become a standalone offence by mid-2026, but opposition leader Leanne Castley says that's not soon enough.

title.children: 'Hidden' form of abuse set to become a crime in the ACT

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders

props.synopsis: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to discontinue charges against him over a 2024 incident.

title.children: Papalii's lawyers say 'wicked' deleted police chat should halt charges

image.altText: A view of an Antarctic ice sheet.

props.synopsis: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

title.children: Spies, security and Antarctic geopolitics: Australia's shifting polar challenges

image.altText: Kwar Ater, wearing a white shirt and smiling hugely.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old was shot dead in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month, leaving his shocked family in search of answers.

title.children: Kwar Ater held his family together. His death has rocked a community

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a church fully engulfed in flame.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a 40-year-old man rammed his pick-up truck through the front door, then got out of the vehicle and started shooting.

title.children: Two dead after gunman opens fire in US Mormon church, setting it on fire

image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

title.children: Fusion-power deal heralds beginning of next great energy transition

image.altText: Illustration of woman wearing Star of David necklace, wearing a green top and hand on chest

props.synopsis: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: Jewish patients share ongoing fear months after Sydney hospital video

image.altText: Back of woman in black top and jeans with long dark hair arms outstretched on stage in front of packed room hands in the air

props.synopsis: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition — she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

title.children: Astrid tried to be a nun. Instead, she launched the world's biggest pub choir

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

title.children: Grieving family’s anger at lack of licence reform amidst government 'buck-passing'

image.altText: A tank sitting in a field, firing an artillery round out of its front gun.

props.synopsis: The military wing of Hamas is calling for Israel to pull troops back and suspend air strikes for 24 hours so fighters can retrieve the captives.

title.children: Hamas loses contact with two hostages as Gaza offensive deepens

image.altText: Adam Reynolds shouts after kicking a goal against Penrith.

props.synopsis: Adam Reynolds took the kicking tee from the Broncos' biggest star in the biggest moment of their season so far, and it paid off in the biggest way possible.

title.children: With the season on the line, Brisbane's biggest star stepped aside

image.altText: A uniformed officer surveys severely damaged buildings and cars

props.synopsis: Ukraine accuses Russia of pounding the country with "hundreds" of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people in the capital.

title.children: Russian missile and drone barrage kills four in Ukraine

image.altText: Man in blue shirt and hat walking away from aircraft.

props.synopsis: Paul Smith, a 54-year-old pilot and sole occupant of the light plane, was returning to Moruya Airport after conducting a skydiving drop on Saturday afternoon when the accident happened.

title.children: Eight skydivers launched from plane just two minutes before fatal crash

image.altText: Three young boys sit behind a train set. The boy in the centre is looking at the camera while the others look at the train.

props.synopsis: It's been dubbed "the forgotten pandemic" — possibly because it coincided with some of the most momentous events in world history. But Dr John Gerrard argues variants of the H3N2 flu, which led to the Hong Kong flu pandemic, continue to cost lives.

title.children: The deadly legacy of the Hong Kong flu and its parallels to COVID-19

image.altText: A fishing boat lilts in dirty, rough water as rescuers hold ropes.

props.synopsis: As Typhoon Bualoi approaches Vietnam, thousands of people are seeking safer ground.

title.children: Typhoon Bualoi forces thousands to evacuate in Vietnam

image.altText: A windmill and streetscape in Cloncurry

props.synopsis: Clear, bright and sunny skies are expected as the Sunshine State's school holidays continue this week.

title.children: Outback temperatures to push 40C during Queensland school holidays

image.altText: Close up photo of a southern pygmy perch in a human hand.

props.synopsis: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.

title.children: Rings on 'ear stones' helping re-establish native pygmy fish

image.altText: police cars on scene

props.synopsis: Police were called to a suburban shopping centre in the early hours of Sunday morning where they declared the man in his 40s dead.

title.children: Man suffers 'brutal and violent attack' before death at Brisbane shops

image.altText: A crowd of men, most wearing white shirts, gather around a small ambulance at night.

props.synopsis: Eight children and 16 women were among those who died at the political rally for Vijay — who is campaigning for election after becoming one of his state's most successful actors.

title.children: Stampede kills 36 people at political rally for popular Indian actor

image.altText: Police tape on a suburban Adelaide street.

props.synopsis: The boy was last seen at his family homestead at about 5pm on Saturday.

title.children: Police searching for four-year-old boy missing in remote SA

image.altText: A group of colourful eggs sit in a basket on grass.

props.synopsis: Compulsory super has led to higher levels of national savings, but, as the pool of savings grows, many argue that stricter supervision is needed to protect Australians' retirement savings.

title.children: Up to 30,000 people at risk of losing some or all their super, ASIC boss warns

image.altText: image of tiny home on wheels.

props.synopsis: Shellharbour Council approves a plan for a tiny homes planning pathway which it says could be adopted statewide, as owners face uncertainty around legal installation.

title.children: 'Easy way forward' for tiny homes as NSW-first pilot gets greenlight

image.altText: A woman and a laughing buddha

props.synopsis: China's presence in the Pacific is often viewed in the context of geopolitical tension and rivalry. But Chinese people have been in the region for generations — these are their stories.

title.children: 'To eat bitterness': In the Pacific, there is 'old' Chinese and 'new' Chinese

image.altText: Large NicheLiving sign hanging from fence sunset in background.

props.synopsis: Kathy Ellis was overjoyed to finally move into her new house after years of building delays. But within days, she discovered her shower was draining straight into the ceiling below.

title.children: Nicheliving customer left with leaking home after plumber uses wrong pipe

image.altText: A white bear with its paw raised like a high five, sitting on a deck with a blue sky background

props.synopsis: A group of polar bears that have taken over an abandoned polar research station off Russia's coast is intimately captured in drone footage.

title.children: Polar bears move into deserted research station in Russian Arctic

image.altText: Jesse Wardlaw shrugs and smiles as she celebrates a goal in an AFLW game.

props.synopsis: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time, while Ally Anderson and Ebony Marinoff become the first players to feature in 100 AFLW games.

title.children: Saints pull off record comeback win as AFLW stars celebrate centuries

image.altText: Julia Robinson runs with the ball away from Yasmin Clydsdale.

props.synopsis: Brisbane is back in the NRLW grand final for the first time in five years, setting up the long-awaited clash with the Sydney Roosters after a 30-6 win over Newcastle.

title.children: Broncos return to NRLW grand final for first time since 2020
